title: 📌 zm,zd: Unpin zvariant_utils version in Cargo.toml files
body:
Otherwise, it breaks the build for folks who happen to have both zbus 3 and 4 in their dependency tree.

Fixes #652.

title: zvariant: Fix compilation of gvariant feature on non-unix platforms
body:
This would fail compilation on eg. windows because the FD generic does not actually exist there.

Reproduce via `cargo build --features="gvariant" --target=x86_64-pc-windows-gnu`

title: ⬆️ Update async-io to v2.3.1
body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [async-io](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io) | dev-dependencies | major | `1.13.0` -> `2.3.1` |
| [async-io](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io) | dependencies | patch | `2.2.2` -> `2.3.1` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>smol-rs/async-io (async-io)</summary>

### [`v2.3.1`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-231)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.3.0...v2.3.1)

-   On Windows, call `WSAStartup` before any raw socket functions. ([#​183](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/183))

### [`v2.3.0`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-230)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.2.2...v2.3.0)

-   Add `Waitable`, which allows waiting for waitable handles on
    Windows. ([#​152](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/152))

### [`v2.2.2`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-222)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.2.1...v2.2.2)

-   Fix an `EINVAL` error that would occur when abstract sockets are used. ([#​176](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/176))

### [`v2.2.1`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-221)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.2.0...v2.2.1)

-   Remove dependency on `waker-fn`. ([#​165](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/165))
-   Update `windows-sys` to v0.52.0. ([#​173](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/173))

### [`v2.2.0`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-220)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.1.0...v2.2.0)

-   Bump `async-lock` and `futures-lite` to their latest version. ([#​170](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/170))

### [`v2.1.0`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-210)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v2.0.0...v2.1.0)

-   Implement `IoSafe` for `std::process::{ChildStdin, ChildStdout, ChildStderr}`. ([#​162](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/162))

### [`v2.0.0`](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-200)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/compare/v1.13.0...v2.0.0)

-   **Breaking:** `Async::new()` now takes types that implement `AsFd`/`AsSocket` instead of `AsRawFd`/`AsRawSocket`, in order to implement I/O safety. ([#​142](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/142))
-   **Breaking:** `Async::get_mut()`, `Async::read_with_mut()` and `Async::write_with_mut()` are now `unsafe`. The underlying source is technically "borrowed" by the polling instance, so moving it out would be unsound. ([#​142](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/142))
-   Expose miscellaneous `kqueue` filters in the `os::kqueue` module. ([#​112](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/112))
-   Expose a way to get the underlying `Poller`'s file descriptor on Unix. ([#​125](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/125))
-   Add a new `Async::new_nonblocking` method to allow users to avoid duplicating an already nonblocking socket. ([#​159](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/159))
-   Remove the unused `fastrand` and `memchr` dependencies. ([#​131](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/131))
-   Use `tracing` instead of `log`. ([#​140](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/140))
-   Support ESP-IDF. ([#​144](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/144))
-   Optimize the `block_on` function to reduce allocation, leading to a slight performance improvement. ([#​149](https://togithub.com/smol-rs/async-io/issues/149))

</details>

title: ⬆️ Update quick-xml to 0.31
body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [quick-xml](https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml) | dependencies | minor | `0.30` -> `0.31` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>tafia/quick-xml (quick-xml)</summary>

### [`v0.31.0`](https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/blob/HEAD/Changelog.md#0310----2023-10-22)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/compare/v0.30.0...v0.31.0)

MSRV bumped to 1.56! Crate now uses Rust 2021 edition.

Enum representation was changed (it was buggy anyway) to ensure compatibility with
serde >= 1.0.181

##### New Features

-   [#​545]: Resolve well-known namespaces (`xml` and `xmlns`) to their appropriate URIs.
    Also, enforce namespace constraints related to these well-known namespaces.
-   [#​635]: Add support for async `ElementWriter` operations.

##### Bug Fixes

-   [#​660]: Fixed incorrect deserialization of `xs:list`s from empty tags (`<tag/>`
    or `<tag></tag>`). Previously an `DeError::UnexpectedEof")` was returned in that case
-   [#​580]: Fixed incorrect deserialization of vectors of newtypes from sequences of tags.
-   [#​661]: More string handling of serialized primitive values (booleans, numbers, strings,
    unit structs, unit variants). `<int>123<something-else/></int>` is no longer valid
    content. Previously all data after `123` up to closing tag would be silently skipped.
-   [#​567]: Fixed incorrect deserialization of vectors of enums from sequences of tags.
-   [#​671]: Fixed deserialization of empty `simpleType`s (for example, attributes) into
    `Option` fields: now they are always deserialized as `Some("")`.

##### Misc Changes

-   [#​643]: Bumped MSRV to 1.56. In practice the previous MSRV was incorrect in many cases.
-   [#​643]: Adopted Rust 2021 edition.
-   [#​545]: Added new `Error` variant -- `Error::InvalidPrefixBind`.
-   [#​651]: Relax requirement for version of `arbitrary` dependency -- we're actually
    compatible with version 1.0.0 and up.
-   [#​649]: Make features linkable and reference them in the docs.
-   [#​619]: Allow to raise application errors in `ElementWriter::write_inner_content`
    (and newly added `ElementWriter::write_inner_content_async` of course).
-   [#​662]: Get rid of some allocations during serde deserialization.
-   [#​665]: Improve serialization of `xs:list`s when some elements serialized to an empty string.
-   [#​630]: Fixed compatibility with serde >= 1.0.181

[#​545]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/545

[#​567]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/issues/567

[#​580]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/issues/580

[#​619]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/issues/619

[#​630]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/issues/630

[#​635]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/635

[#​643]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/643

[#​649]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/646

[#​651]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/651

[#​660]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/660

[#​661]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/661

[#​662]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/662

[#​665]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/pull/665

[#​671]: https://togithub.com/tafia/quick-xml/issues/671

</details>

#### Changes

-   Resolves an issue in some workflows that were caused by a recent change to permission handling.

### [`v4.3.2`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.3.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.3.1...v4.3.2)

#### Changes

-   Resolves an issue with folder permissions that causes an issue in container workflows when rsync attempts to run.

### [`v4.3.1`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.3.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.3.0...v4.3.1)

#### Changes

-   Resolves an issue caused by Git 2.36 when running the action within a container.
    -   The working directory is now added to the `safe.directory` global directory.
    -   Integration tests have been updated so one of the samples run in a Docker container so this gets picked up by integration tests in the future.

### [`v4.3.0`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.2.5...v4.3.0)

#### Changes

-   Implements a new option available behind a flag, `force`. If set to `false` the action will no longer force push, instead attempting 3 times to resolve rejected commits when making parallel/subsequent deployments. In a future version `false` will be set as the default. Massive thanks to [@​rossjrw](https://togithub.com/rossjrw) for this feature addition.
-   Modified the Node version which the action is developed/tested against from `14` to `16`.

#### Minor Changes

-   Third-party dependency updates.
-   Test coverage improvements.

### [`v4.2.5`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.2.5)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.2.4...v4.2.5)

#### Minor Changes

-   Corrects an issue in the publishing pipeline that was causing workflow failures.

### [`v4.2.4`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.2.4)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.2.3...v4.2.4)

#### Minor Changes

-   Modified how workflow notices get displayed.  ([#​1033](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/issues/1033) Thanks to [@​hemberger](https://togithub.com/hemberger))
-   Dependency upgrades.

### [`v4.2.3`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.2.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/v4.2.2...v4.2.3)

#### Minor Changes

-   Improved action logging. This is part 1 or 2 updates that will make the logs easier to traverse. Warnings and notices are now provided so you don't need to expand the logs to get the termination message.
-   Dependency bumps across the board.

### [`v4.2.2`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/v4.2.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.2.1...v4.2.2)

#### Minor Changes

-   Introduces major version tags. You can now point your workflow to `JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@v4` if you'd like to always have the most cutting edge changes outside of using the release branch directly.
-   The version tags for this project now include a `v` to be consistent with other officially provided actions by GitHub. You can use `JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@v4.2.2` for instance. Dependabot should pick up this change automatically.

### [`v4.2.1`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/4.2.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.2.0...4.2.1)

#### Minor Changes

-   Resolves an issue where the operating system warning was showing incorrectly.

### [`v4.2.0`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/4.2.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.1.9...4.2.0)

### Happy New Year 2022!

![London](https://media.giphy.com/media/pYhFb0kn2GhQQ/giphy.gif)

#### Minor Changes

-   Implements a warning if you're using an unsupported operating system. This will occur if the workflow runs within MacOS or Windows. The workflow will not be cancelled.
-   The action is now case insensitive, allowing you to make casing changes to files so long as you commit them using the `git mv` command prior to the workflow running. ([#​895](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/issues/895))
-   Fixes an issue that was causing `single-commit` to fail when using `repository-name` if the branch name was equal from the origin to destination. ([#​665](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/issues/665))
-   Enabled Dependabot updates for the GitHub Actions that are used as part of the projects integration tests.
-   Made improvements to the issue template.
-   Modified the dev container so it now properly runs on Node 14 when used within GitHub Codespaces.
-   Modified the default exclude list to use an enum value to ensure accuracy.
-   Dependency upgrades.

### [`v4.1.9`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/4.1.9)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.1.8...4.1.9)

#### Minor Changes

-   Dependency/security updates from third parties.

### [`v4.1.8`](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/releases/tag/4.1.8)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.1.7...4.1.8)

#### Minor Changes

-   Library dependency and security bumps.
-   README modifications.

#### New Contributors

-   [@​anushbhatia](https://togithub.com/anushbhatia) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/pull/924](https://togithub.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/pull/924)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action/compare/4.1.7...4.1.8

</details>

title: 🐛zx: correctly check if fdo ifaces is empty
body:
Fixes an issue where instead of checking if `fdo_standard_ifaces` was empty, it was accidentally checked if the prefix string was empty. Found by (and thanks to) @Cobinja in https://github.com/dbus2/zbus/commit/35c15c8d9e8e730dee6bdbfa6997cd7d83a8f738#r138622943.

I totally blame clippy for not having a lint against this :)

title: 🚩 zb: Disable UDS support on Windows for tokio
body:
Since tokio currently [does not support Unix domain sockets on Windows][tuds], there is no reason to enable UDS support on Windows+tokio. This also fixes a build warning against rust nightly:

```rust
error: field `0` is never read
  --> zbus\src\connection\builder.rs:45:16
   |
45 |     UnixStream(UnixStream),
   |     ---------- ^^^^^^^^^^
   |     |
   |     field in this variant
   |
   = note: `-D dead-code` implied by `-D warnings`
   = help: to override `-D warnings` add `#[allow(dead_code)]`
help: consider changing the field to be of unit type to suppress this warning while preserving the field numbering, or remove the field
   |
45 |     UnixStream(()),
   |                ~~
```

[tuds]: https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/issues/2201

The nix::unistd::Uid API requires the user feature, per https://docs.rs/nix/0.26.4/nix/unistd/struct.Uid.html

title: 📝 Remove 1.0 version of the book
body: We're already now at 4.0 so I don't see any reason to keep the old book around. The point of the book is to learn about zbus as a beginner and we really don't want people to learn 1.0 API.

title: A few fixes and improvements
body: Came up with these while porting `busd` to the new API.

title: 🩹 fix impl (Try)From for owning values
🏷️ zb: Represent abstract socket name as OsString
body: instead of byte vector. This seems like a better representation for the abstract socket name and typically the name is ASCII anyway.

title: ♻️  zb: Split Display impl of address::Transport
body: Let each transport impl have its own Display impl. This not only makes the code more readbable, but also makes it possible for users to display the transport types independently.

title: 🦺 zx: Allow unrestricted property names in zbus-xmlgen
body:
This fixes #550 by adding a struct PropertyName to zbus-names. It's essentially a copy of the already existing struct MemberName but only checks for the name length instead of enforcing all name restrictions.
Also added/changed the appropriate tests.

title: 📌 zb: Pin tokio to only its major version
body: This allows it to be upgraded to any API-compatible versions. This implicitly also fixes a regression from e0c785a, where we ended up using API from a newer version of tokio than we depend on.

title: zb: Replace once_cell usage
body: Replace the usage of OnceCell/Lazy from the once_cell crate with std types equivalents. The types were added before the current MSRV of zbus

title: 💥 zb: Improved Address API
body:
Main changes:

* Split transport bits of `Address` into a separate type, `Transport`.
* `Address` now support GUIDs, rather than ignoring them.
* Improved `Guid` type.
* `connection::Builder` ensure GUID is correct if the client connection is constructed through an address with GUID in it.
* Proper support for abstract unix sockets.

Fixes #329, #476.

title: ✨ zx: improve user visible output
body:
Since code for `org.freedesktop.DBus` interfaces is not generated, direct the user to https://docs.rs/zbus/latest/zbus/fdo/index.html instead of silently skipping them. In addition, this adds more information, indicating which interfaces were generated; if the interfaces are written to different files, the filename is also printed.

Example output when writing all interfaces to the same file:
```
Skipping `org.freedesktop.DBus` interfaces, please use https://docs.rs/zbus/latest/zbus/fdo/index.html
Generated code for `org.freedesktop.UDisks2.Manager`
Generated code for `org.freedesktop.UDisks2.Manager.NVMe`
…
```
Example output when writing interfaces to the different files (default behavior):
```
Skipping `org.freedesktop.DBus` interfaces, please use https://docs.rs/zbus/latest/zbus/fdo/index.html
Generated code for `org.freedesktop.UDisks2.Manager` in Manager.rs
Generated code for `org.freedesktop.UDisks2.Manager.NVMe` in NVMe.rs
…
```

This mainly removes accidental enabling of the tokio feature in one of the `cargo test` runs. This likely means that we've been running most of the tests on Linux with tokio-only for a long time now (since 3.0 probably). This PR aims to fix that.

Some other fixes and a workaround also included.

title: 🔥 zb: Panic on `Optional<bool>` type
body:
While we implement `NoneValue` for all `Default` types for convenience (both ours and users), we don't want to do that for `bool` because there is no way to distinguish between `None` and `false` in that case.

So let's panic on that and document this behavior.

body:
Hopefully this finally fixes the Windows CI being unable to download `pkg-config`.
    
Fixes #441.

title: Support non-native endian
body:
With this PR, zbus can now received and decode non-native endian-encoded messages and replies to them in the same endian.

I first tried to solve this using `byteorder` that we were already using but that turned out to be a huge change and extremely disruptive, breaking all API. This is because `byteorder` handles things through a trait and if your types hold endian-encoded data in a generic way, you need a generic added to your types as well. This ended up having to add the generic to Message, Connection, Proxy etc. That would have also meant that user has to make a decision, which encoding to use and we'll not be able to receive messages in any other encoding, which is unexpected from dbus implementations (according to comments in GIO code).

So I ended up creating a new crate, [`endi`](https://crates.io/crates/endi) that uses an enum instead. While enum could be *slightly* less performant and larger binary size, in most cases the compiler is able to optimize out the match and the performance ends up the same as that of `byteorder`.

Fixes #252.
